metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29972 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found via testing, and traced to an out-of-date Cairo library. Updating the library resolved the issue, and may have remediated other, unknown security vulnerabilities as well. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 90.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29972` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '90.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
